Dies ist ein gemeinsames Projekt der TUI Care Foundation und der internationalen Tierschutzorganisation World Animal Protection.

In 2014 und 2015 wurde zum Erhalt des traditionellen Weinbaus auf Lanzarote dieses Projekt erschaffen, das gleichzeitig Inselbewohnern mit Behinderung erstmals sinnvolle Beschäftigungsmöglichkeiten bietet: https://www.tuicarefoundation.com/de
Die TUI Care Foundation unterstützt dieses einzigartige Weinprojekt zusammen mit örtlichen Organisationen, darunter Ecopalmer und Grevislan.

In the final episode, Jack chats with those involved in the Spengler Cup, a century-old ice hockey tournament taking place over Christmas in Davos. He hears from President Marc Gianola, Head of Project Jacqueline Kühne, star player Matěj Stránský, and Leah Marino from HC Davos’ newly-formed womens’ team. Before he leaves, Jack also picks up some tips on being a sports announcer from seasoned pro Georges Lüchinger, known as the Voice of the Spengler cup.

Whether you’re in the market for a Matisse or an art enthusiast keen to discover the next sculpting sensation, the fair Art Basel in Basel has something for everyone. Jack discovers how it collaborates with the city’s many cultural institutions, learns about the diverse architecture of the city and also experiences a Basel rite of passage… floating down the Rhine river with his Wickelfisch.

Did you know fairy tales come true? But only in St. Moritz, where horses race across a frozen lake over three weekends each winter. Jack investigates this one-of-a-kind event, speaking with Dennis Schiergen, the Head of Racing and a former jockey, Valeria Schiergen, the first ever female skijorer to win in St. Moritz, and horse owner Sabrina Casty (with her horse, naturally).

Nico Franzoni und Noah Bachofen sind Gourmetfreunde und Influencer. Und als solche schickt sie Schweiz Tourismus auf eine Tour quer durch die Schweiz: In drei Sprachregionen, an ungewöhnliche Orte und zu lauter Menschen mit Liebe für Lebensmittel. Überall geht es um Food und um die Einzigartigkeit von Geschmäckern. Nicos und Noahs Mission: Zutaten aus dem ganzen Land sammeln und sie danach zu einem Menü kochen, das für die Vielfalt der Schweiz steht. Und: Den Röstigraben «zukochen». Los geht’s.

Whilst in Wengen, Jack is taken on a very special walk: the 4.4 km route of the legendary Lauberhorn downhill ski run. He sees the stomach-churning twists, turns and jumps up close and speaks at length with Olympic skier Bruno Kernen about what it’s like to throw yourself off a mountain at 100mph.

A golf tournament on the side of a mountain? It must be the Omega European Masters. Jack meets a future golf star, gets the inside scoop on George Clooney’s favourite meal at the VIP tent, and chats to tournament-winner Matt Wallace about overcoming self-doubt.

Music is in the air as Jack arrives in Montreux, where he discovers what attracts such huge stars to this Swiss Riviera town, and the real-life story behind Deep Purple’s classic anthem, ‘Smoke on the Water’. He also learns about the region’s influence on the Romantic poets Byron and Shelley - and catches an intimate gig with a recent superstar at Montreux’s famous late-night jam session.

Think you know classical music? Think again. Lucerne Festival wants to challenge everything you expect about the genre, including where it should be performed, who it’s intended for, and even the very definition of classical music. Expect pop-up Vivaldi, avant-garde pieces and a concert hall with a lake running through it.

At Weltklasse Zurich, Jack discovers why it’s such a respected track and field meet. He learns what the organisation is doing to support young people across Switzerland, and the commitment to mental health in sport. He meets legendary hurdler Colin Jackson, watches pole vaulters competing in a train station, and takes a tour of the city where he learns about some strange Zürich traditions.

Jack arrives in Locarno for the film festival and chats with Ben Burtt, the sound designer for Star Wars, Indiana Jones, ET and Wall-E, as well as the up-and-coming Lithuanian filmmaker Saulė Bliuvaitė. He finds out what sets Locarno apart, how it defends unique cinema, the support for young talent, and how it kickstarted Spike Lee’s career.

The spiral viaduct at Brusio: The train needed to bridge a considerable difference in altitude in a very short distance. And since it was a train built specifically for tourists who wanted to see the lovely landscape, the train had to go through as few tunnels as possible. The name of this route speaks for itself: Its seven stages take you through the cradle of Switzerland. The origins and culture of Central Switzerland are explored as you tour along refreshing lakes, scenic mountain pass roads and valleys steeped in history. Don’t miss the opportunity to sample some culinary highlights and specialities.

Anyone who knows a bit about the holiday region of Saas-Fee/Saas Valley will immediately think of the Mischabel chain. The adventure trail leading up to the Almagelleralp is not as widely known, however. Venturing across suspension bridges and rocky sections reminiscent of a via ferrata, as well as through a magical fairy-tale forest, you finally reach the mountain hotel run by Urs Anthamatten, the hotel’s host – or, as he jokingly calls it, “hotel director”.

Hike from Martigny to Leuk to discover the Valais vineyards.

Petite Arvine, Cornalin and Heida are just some of the best-known wines of the Valais winegrowing area. The grapes ripen in the Rhone Valley, which is crossed by the Chemin du Vignoble. This hike takes walkers from Martigny to Leuk to discover some of the steepest vineyards in the world. This is the Eldorado for canyoning enthusiasts, brave souls who experience unique emotions between spectacular rock formations and cool water.

The various vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free and lactose-free menus offered in all youth hostels make an important contribution to ecological sustainability. However, purchasing is also essential, as the Swiss Youth Hostels prefer local and seasonal products in order to keep CO2 emissions as low as possible.

----
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/accommodations/other-types-of-accommodations/youth-hostels/

The Swiss Youth Hostels work with a comprehensive environmental management system that takes ecology into account during construction as well as during operation. Almost all youth hostels are certified with the ibex fairstay label. 

----
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/accommodations/other-types-of-accommodations/youth-hostels/

Prices are designed to keep services affordable while still ensuring very good quality and fair wages. Inclusion of the disadvantaged includes, in particular, freedom from barriers.

----
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/accommodations/other-types-of-accommodations/youth-hostels/

The aim is to make the entire range of services offered by the Swiss Youth Hostels - from obtaining information on the Internet to the establishments - obstacle-free.

----
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/accommodations/other-types-of-accommodations/youth-hostels/

Everything is a little different in the Val Piora. Situated at 2,000 metres above sea level, this high mountain valley in the canton of Ticino boasts an extraordinary diversity of fauna and flora, along with more than 20 mountain lakes – one of which is so mysterious that it attracts researchers from all over the world. Microbiologist Raffaele Peduzzi explains what it is that makes the Val Piora so special – for day trippers, hikers and researchers alike.

Valais summers are hot and dry! Farmers in the region have constructed spectacular irrigation channels over the years to ensure a sufficient supply of water for their meadows and animals. These channels transport the precious commodity from the mountains to the mountain villages. Once there, the water is distributed using conventional irrigation methods. Organic farmer Franziska Schmid has learnt these methods herself, preserving this valuable cultural heritage for the next generation.

The Alpine buckthorn is like the lemon of the mountains. It has a wonderful acidity and a special open, floral flavour - as well as being extremely rich in vitamins. It is regularly used by the rising star of the Swiss gourmet restaurant scene, Sven Wassmer, Culinary Director at the Grand Resort Bad Ragaz and star chef at “Memories” restaurant, which is found in both the Michelin and GaultMilau guides. Gentle, rolling hills, vast orchards and lakes with picture-perfect sunsets – Aargau is nature at its finest. History and culture buffs will find just what they’re looking for here, too: with 43 castles, palaces, ruins and the historical links between the Habsburgs and Aargau going back 1,000 years, there is plenty to discover. A road trip through Aargau offers the greatest possible variety of experiences for such a small region.
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/summer-autumn/summ

A sparkling blue lake, lush green meadows and, nestled between them, the old city walls surrounding the mediaeval town of Murten. This is the perfect place for a leisurely stroll through picturesque alleyways and arcades, past historic town houses and fountains adorned with flowers. Then put your feet up and enjoy a boat trip with Captain Corinne Stauffer.
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/summer-autumn/summervacations/stories/town-countryside-lake-murten/

Caroline and Eugenio – two ardent golf enthusiasts who could not be more different from each other. Caroline Rominger, the 35-year-old giant of the Swiss golf scene and Eugenio Rüegger, the 80-year-old golf pioneer and family friend of Rominger. The two are united by both a passion for the links and an overwhelming love for Graubünden. 
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/summer-autumn/summervacations/stories/two-generations-one-passion/

A spectacular ridge trail connects the two peaks of Klingenstock and Fronalpstock, high above Lake Lucerne, amazing hikers with imposing abysses and a 360-degree panorama. The ridge trail is well-developed and maintained thanks to volunteers like pensioners Sepp Betschart and Gottlieb Arnold. Their reward? The gratitude of those hiking the trail.
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/summer-autumn/summervacations/stories/the-most-beautiful-workplace-in-the-world/

Hiking is too slow for him. That’s how Stéphane Aymon discovered trail running. On the ridge trail around Nendaz and Veysonnaz, he trains for the 70-kilometer-long Grand Parcours des Nendaz Trail – happily pushing his body to its limits.
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/summer-autumn/summervacations/stories/ridge-walk-to-happiness/

The people of Val d’Hérens in Valais are proud of three things: their “patois” dialect, the Dent Blanche peak and their Hérens cows. In summer, high on Alp Mandelon, enclosed by in the wild mountain environment you’ll find four of these proud and pugnacious beasts belonging to Morgane Seppey. She and her family keep a herd of Hérens cows, thus preserving centuries of tradition. 
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/summer-autumn/summervacations/stories/women-power-in-val-dherens/

Cédric Chezeaux is living the dream: 15 years ago he turned his back on conventional agriculture. Since then he has been cultivating old, almost forgotten grains of organic quality near Romainmôtier. Today people from all over Europe visit him in search of genuine, traditional foods and uncompromising quality. The unique landscape of the Vaud Jura ensures that they usually stay a little longer.   
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/summer-autumn/summervacations/stories/the-grain-whi

Valais is famous for the amount of sun it receives and its lovely wines. In the winegrowing village of Salgesch in the middle of the Pfyn-Finges Nature Park, Luc Mounir and his family grow top-quality wines. They primarily work with traditional varieties and follow principles based on nature – something appreciated by both future generations of wine lovers and visitors to the nature park. 
https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/summer-autumn/summervacations/stories/switzerlands-wine-par

Basel ist die Schweizer Stadt mit der grössten Dichte an Museen. Nicht zu reden von der Art Basel! Aber was viele nicht wissen: Kunst hat in der Rheinstadt eine lange Tradition.
In Zürich-West, wo einst Schiffe gebaut wurden, stehen heute Kunst, Gastronomie, Shopping und Architektur im Mittelpunkt. Und eine der bedeutendsten Plakatsammlungen der Welt!

Grazie anche all'intuizione di Arturo Toscanini, Lucerna ospita dal 1938 una delle rassegne di musica classica più note a livello mondiale: il Lucerne Festival che per tre volte all'anno trasforma la città in un palcoscenico internazionale. Orchestre e solisti di grido si esibiscono nella sala del Centro Cultura e Congressi (KKL).

Chia ama lo sport sarà certamente felice sul Lago di Lucerna, dove si possono praticare quasi tutti i tipi di sport acquatici. Per quanto riguarda l'escursionismo, l'alpinismo e il cicloturismo, la regione del Lago di Lucerna è un vero paradiso. Basta ammirare il paesaggio delle montagne circostanti per capirlo. E anche il golf vanta una lunga tradizione.

Lucerna è il punto di partenza ideale di numerose escursioni verso le destinazioni più belle della Svizzera Centrale. Il paesaggio è straordinario anche percorrendo i sentieri invernali e il clima mita e gli accoglienti hotel wellness attirano anche gli ospiti in cerca di relax.

Immersa in un impressionante panorama montano, Lucerna è la porta d'ingresso della Svizzera Centrale, sul Lago dei Quattro Cantoni. È piacevole passeggiare tra queste vie silenziose alla scoperta di facciate decorate, negozi e locali d'atmosfera che si affacciano sul lago e sul fiume Reuss.

Swiss cities never fail to impress visitors by their scope. Nowhere are attractions, cultural centres, innovative gastronomy, insider's tips and new favourite places in such close proximity as in Switzerland.

Switzerland may be best known for its glorious natural land- scapes, but it is also heaven for art enthusiasts. Nowhere else in the world can you find such a variety of top-quality cultural attractions in such a compact area. The cities are urban masterpieces in their own right. A combinat

The Zentrum Paul Klee is much more than a museum. The influential complex also serves as a research site focusing on the many facets of the artist Paul Klee, a performance venue and a cultural centre hosting a wide range of activities.
| Switzerland Tourism

Superb modern and contemporary art, thrilling architecture and an idyllic natural setting combine to give the Fondation Beyeler its unique appeal. The high-quality programme of exhibitions enjoys an outstanding international reputation.

Four collections – Poster, Design, Graphics and Applied Art – encompass more than 500,000 objects at the Museum für Gestaltung. Switzerland’s foremost museum of design and visual communication is also one of the leading institutions in Europe, known for its fascinating temporary exhibitions.

The Mamco, Geneva’s Musée d’art moderne et contemporain is original in every way. Since it opened in 1994, Switzerland’s major contemporary art museum has operated a dynamic display policy. | Switzerland Tourism
The Kunsthaus Zürich presents works dating from the 13th century to the present day. The ground-breaking temporary exhibitions are as prestigious as the museum’s superb collection of modern art.

The Museum Tinguely houses the world’s largest collection of art by Jean Tinguely, famous for his moving mechanical sculptures. Interactive exhibitions explore his influences, the work of his contemporaries and the latest trends.

The internationally renowned Musée de l’Elysée is one of Europe’s leading museums devoted entirely to photography. The building that houses it is exceptionally photo- genic: an 18th-century villa with views of Lake Geneva

LAC Lugano Arte e Cultura is the new cultural centre of the city and a fresh focus for visual arts, music and the performing arts in Ticino. Opened in 2015, the complex reinforces Lugano’s role as a cultural crossroads between northern and southern Europe. | Switzerland Tourism
| Switzerland Tourism

스위스를 다녀오신 많은 분들이 마테호른(Matterhotn)이라는 명봉의 매력에 푹 빠져 옵니다.  
명봉 마테호른의 얼짱 각도를 품고 산기슭에 자리한 체르마트는 '마테호른의 마테호른에 의한 마테호른을 위한 마을'이라고 해도 좋을듯 합니다. 
차량통행이 금지된 청정 휴양지역으로, 지속가능한 관광자원 개발로 고유의 형태를 유지하려는 노력이 무던히 이어지고 있습니다. 
체르마트는 또 산악 액티버티로도 유명합니다. 한여름 만년설에서 즐기는 스키부터 패러글라이딩, 산악자전거, 몬스터바이크 등 다양한 체험이 가능합니다.

산과 도시 그리고 호수를 함께 즐길 수 있는 루체른으로 한번 떠나 보시죠.

The spaghetti tree hoax is a famous 3-minute hoax report broadcast on April Fools' Day 1957 by the BBC current affairs programme Panorama. It told a tale of a family in southern Switzerland harvesting spaghetti from the fictitious spaghetti tree, broadcast at a time when this Italian dish was not widely eaten in the UK and some Britons were unaware that spaghetti is a pasta made from wheat flour and water. Munich has a proud history of LGBTQ+ activism, being one of the first cities in Germany to celebrate Christopher Street Day (CSD) and home to Rosa Liste, Europe’s first LGBTQ+ political party with local council seats in the 1990s. 🌈
This video takes you through Munich’s vibrant Pride parades, queer Oktoberfest traditions, and festive events like Pink Christmas in the Glockenbachviertel. Celebrate diversity, love, and joy in this welcoming city! 🏳️‍🌈

👉 Learn more about LGBTQ+ activities in Munic

München kann auf eine stolze Geschichte des LGBTIQ*-Aktivismus zurückblicken: Es war eine der ersten Städte in Deutschland, die den Christopher Street Day (CSD) feierte, und die Heimat der Rosa Liste, der ersten LGBTIQ*-Partei Europas, die in den 1990er Jahren im Stadtrat vertreten war. 🌈
Dieses Video führt Sie durch Münchens lebendige Pride-Paraden, queere Oktoberfesttraditionen und festliche Veranstaltungen wie Pink Christmas im Glockenbachviertel. Feiern Sie Vielfalt, Liebe und Freude in dies

One can objectively conclude that while autumn is beautiful everywhere, it is most beautiful in Munich. After all, where else is there such a sprawling folk festival dedicated solely to October every year? What city can offer such an internationally acclaimed bow to this season?

Customs and traditions in which ghosts and horrible creatures make mischief have been rooted in Bavaria for centuries. Such rituals and devilish figures as Perchten and Krampusse accompany this magical time. And even today, Bavarians still follow the mythical customs in many regions, for example in the Upper Palatinate.

The Benedictine abbey with its rich past and magnificent Asam church is located in the middle of the unique European natural heritage Weltenburger Enge at the entrance to the impressive Danube Gorge. On a boat trip from Kelheim to Weltenburg Abbey you can admire the up to 70 m high limestone cliffs. The excursion is rounded off perfectly by a visit to Weltenburg Abbey.

Unser Rezept für hessischen Entenbraten kombiniert eine würzige Füllung aus Äpfeln, Zwiebeln und Thymian mit einer fruchtig-aromatischen Apfelweinsauce. Dazu reichen wir  Apfel-Sellerie-Püree. Der traditionelle Weihnachtsstollen verbindet sich mit hessischem Charme: Apfelwein sorgt für besondere Saftigkeit und ein fruchtiges Aroma. So schmeckt die Weihnachtszeit in Hessen. Für die ideale Textur zieht der Stollen am besten einige Wochen vor Genuss gut durch. Perfekt für den Adventskaffee oder als Geschenk – daher backen wir auch gleich zwei Stollen auf einmal. Was passiert, wenn sich der Mensch aus dem Wald zurückzieht und die Wildnis wieder Einzug hält? Finde es heraus! Ontdek een van de meest veelzijdige regio’s in het midden van Europa:
Wandelen, fietsen, cultuur live beleven en genieten in Hessen.

Kommt mit uns auf eine Reise durch Hessen. Wie zeigen euch wie schön es bei uns gleich nebenan ist!

Bei uns in Hessen gibt es neben den Städten wie Frankfurt, Wiesbaden Darmstadt und Marburg mit ihrem vielseitigen Kultur Programm auch einige der letzten alten Buchenwälder Deutschlands, blühende Streuobstwiesen, bizarre Vulkanlandschaften, idyllische Mittelgebirge, romantische Flusslandschaften und vieles weitere zum Genießen.

In jeder der elf hessischen Destinationen gibt es  regionaltypische

Über 600 Kilometer Bahntrassenradwege können in Hessen unter die Räder genommen werden. Ob BahnRadweg Hessen, Milseburgradweg, Vogelsberger Südbahnradweg oder der Bahnradweg Rotkäppchenland - alle verlaufen sie auf ehemaligen Bahntrassen und verfügen daher meist nur über geringe Steigungen. Entdecken Sie die zahlreichen Möglichkeiten zum Bahntrassenradeln in Hessen und erfahren Sie mehr zu den einzelnen Radwegen unter www.hessen-tourismus.de

Radeln am Fluss in Hessen - das bedeutet geringe Steigungen meistern, traumhafte Flusstäler genießen und malerische Fachwerkstädtchen entdecken. Über 1100 km Fluss-Radwege gilt es in Hessen zu erradeln. Ob im Norden, im Süden, im Osten oder Westen - wir bieten die schönsten Fluss-Radwege! Erfahren Sie mehr unter www.hessen-tourismus.de

The perfect holiday is more like several holidays rolled into one. It provides activity, comfort and freedom, and the opportunity to explore and experience local life from your doorstep. It's called Eurocamp, and it's the stuff that memories are made of.

To learn more about our holidays visit www.eurocamp.co.uk

We have created this video using stop frame photography to give you an insight into one day of a Eurocamp holiday. The short film illustrates how families can Go, discover, and share their special moments together on holiday, as well an insight into the activities and locations available. The video should give you a flavour of why all kinds of people enjoy our holidays and shows you how fun they really are.
